intro: Olgaea hsiaowutaishanensis, commonly known as the Xiaowutaishan olgaea, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are simple and ovate, with a smooth texture and a slight pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
